comments:
Hi,

the methode JPatternDictionary.getQualifiedName() runs into a nullpointer access
if the compilationUnit contains no package declaration. This breaks the
set*CompilationUnit methods (see stacktrace).

Since wrong units in the context of templates are usual it would be nice if this
could be more robust. In this case maybe it works if jPackage is just
initialized with an empty package.

I know that a compilation unit without a package mackes not much sense. But I
run into the problem by deveoping an example for my generator framework, so I
assume users would also do. The only chance I have to report the problem to the
user and logs is to catch the NPE, not a good way, you know ;-)

stacktrace:
-----
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.jmerge.JPatternDictionary.getQualifiedName(JPatternDictionary.java:181)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.jmerge.JPatternDictionary.analyzeType(JPatternDictionary.java:115)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.jmerge.JPatternDictionary.analyzeCompilationUnit(JPatternDictionary.java:94)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.jmerge.JPatternDictionary.<init>(JPatternDictionary.java:61)
	at
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.jmerge.JMerger.setTargetCompilationUnit(JMerger.java:134)
The fix is committed to CVS.
This is fixed in the latest driver.
